channel.title: The drawString() Method
channel.description:
This method is contained in the Graphics class of the java.awt package. It draws a String to the screen (a line of text). I would like to point out quickly that this method is abstract, therefore the place where you use this method must me abstract, too. Also, the class may not be referred to for a method. You must instantiate a Graphics object and refer to that when calling a non-imported method. To call the drawString method, you would do the following: [code]Graphics.drawString(String str, int x, int y);[/code]
Or if you want you could import the class, or complete package, but that would require making the class you are putting it in abstract; not just the place where you are putting it in.
For the object reference, Graphics would be the name of a instantiated Graphics object. For the first parameter (String str), you would put the String you want to output. This can be either be a declared String, or just a line in quotations. For the second parameter (int x), you would put the X coordinate of where you want to output the String on the screen. For the last parameter (int y) you would put the Y coordinate of where you want to output the String on the screen. Coordinates start in the upper-left corner of the screen. X goes down, Y goes right. Therefore, [code]Graphics.drawString("Thank you for reading.", 0, 0);[/code] Would output [b]Thank you for reading[/b] at the top-left corner of the screen.

item.title: The drawString() Method
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

[quote=“Nets8, post:22, topic:193706”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=257850.msg2153997#msg2153997 date=1207112096]
Nets8, when you talk about server-side on a forum such as MSCP, you are meaning RuneScape Private Servers. Not anything else. So in conclusion, this is not server-side, but client-side.
[/quote]

With simple sockets, this is very much server-side. Don’t argue with me. Moparscapers should learn this, not the made-up Java they learn right now.[/quote]

I don’t see where the syntax of the language changes to made-up to real.

Read full topic

item.title: The drawString() Method
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Nets8, post:22, topic:193706”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=257850.msg2153997#msg2153997 date=1207112096]
Nets8, when you talk about server-side on a forum such as MSCP, you are meaning RuneScape Private Servers. Not anything else. So in conclusion, this is not server-side, but client-side.
[/quote]

With simple sockets, this is very much server-side. Don’t argue with me. Moparscapers should learn this, not the made-up Java they learn right now.[/quote]Sigh. Dont tell me what to do. Your nonstop MoparScaper term is pissing me off. Using it as an insult while being one yourself is considered hypocrisy. “With simple sockets…” notice the ‘with.’ Do servers here have the ‘with’ part? No. So, I’m right.

EDIT: Alright, I was in a rush earlier.
You mentioned simple sockets, e.g. connecting to client, and then making the client perform the action. Sort of like an ‘international’ call to a method, if you want to make it sound childish. The action still occurs from the client, not from the server. You can call it server-side only if you like to stretch it, A LOT.

Read full topic
